place.name: ASHEN
place.gazetteerText: ASHEN, a parish in the district of Risbridge and county of Essex; on the verge of the county, at the river Stour, 2½ miles SW of Clare, and 3¼ NNW of Yeldham r. station. Post Town, Bumpstead-Steeple under Halstead. Acres, 1,498. Real property, £2,528. Pop., 344. Houses, 71. The property is subdivided. An Augustinian priory was founded here in the time of Edward II. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £300.* Patron, the Duchy of Lancaster. The church was repaired in 1859. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
